title: Bennet Christensen
text:
Biography
My primary interest is statistical applications in health and economic settings. I am especially drawn to causal inference and spatial statistics. When I’m not doing statistics I enjoy running my school’s board game and quiz bowl clubs.

title: Bennet Christensen
text:
Education
Macalester College | St. Paul MN 
B.A. in Statistics (Honors) | Sept 2020 - May 2024

title: Bennet Christensen

title: Brown v. Plata (2011): Mental Health Outcomes and Prison Reform
text: My Statistics Honors project at Macalester College, advised by Professor Leslie Myint.

title: Macalester Causal Simulation Package
text: R package made to support students learning how to simulate causal inference data for Macalester’s Stat 451 class. The link to the repository for this can be found here

title: Survival of the Closest
text: Project presented at the Midwestern Undergraduate Geography Symposium hosted at the University of St. Thomas in 2023. The project was presented as a story map that can be found here

title: Defense Contractors in Maryland
text: Independent study focused on web scraping government contracts, advised by Professor Bryan Martin, Fall 2022.

title: A Neighborhood Analysis of Drug/Narcotic Arrests in Seattle, Washington
text: Capstone project for Correlated Data, Spring 2022, viewable here

title: Brain Cancer: Determinants of Health
text: My capstone project for Survival Analysis, completed by me and Alex McCreight, Fall 2022.
